name: Indonesian Music
description: Music of the Indonesian people, including those of the majority groups residing in Java, Sumatra, Kalimantan, Bali and other major native areas.

children.name: Batak Music
children.description: Music of the Batak people, an Austronesian people native to Sumatra.

children.name: Dangdut
children.description: Indonesian popular music distinguished by a rhythmic blend of Indian, Arabic, Western, Malay, Sundanese, and Javanese influences within Indonesian Music, characterized by a unique rhythmic pattern from kendang.

children.name: Gambang kromong
children.description: Betawi traditional music which combines elements of Gamelan, Western music and a Chinese-derived pentatonic scale.

children.name: Kakawin
children.description: Form of Indonesian poetry written in Kawi, performed melodically using a structured pattern of long and short syllables.

children.name: Keroncong
children.description: Early form of popular Indonesian Music from the 19th-20th century, inspired by Portuguese sailor songs brought to the archipelago during the colonial era.

children.name: Orkes gambus
children.description: Indonesian songs based on Arabic hits, adapted for a small ensemble featuring the gambus lute, percussion, and electric instruments.

children.name: Qasidah modern
children.description: Islamic pop that emerged on the Indonesian island of Java during the 1970s, updating a form of classic Arabic Poetry known as "qasidah".

children.name: Rapai dabõih
children.description: Religious music meant to accompany the dabõih ceremony of the Acehnese people.

children.name: Tanjidor
children.description: Betawi form of street music ensemble derived from colonial Marching Bands.
